chh.util

Class Number

  • java.lang.Object
    • chh.util.Number

  • public final class Number
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class containing calculations on numbers.
    Version:
    2011.06.16
    Author:
    Christopher H. Harvey

    • Method Detail

      • isPrime

        public static boolean isPrime(int n)
        Returns whether a given integer is prime. An integer is mathematically prime if and only if its only integer divisors are itself and 1.
        Parameters:
        n - the given integer
        Returns:
        true if n is prime

      • isPowerOf

        public static boolean isPowerOf(int n,
                int r)
        Determines whether a given integer n is a power of an integer r.
        Parameters:
        n - the given integer to test
        r - the given root
        Returns:
        true if n is a power of r

      • aMean

        public static double aMean(double a,
           double b)
        Returns the arithmetic mean of two doubles. The arithmetic mean of 'a' and 'b' is exactly half of the sum of 'a' and 'b'.
        Parameters:
        a - the first double
        b - the second double
        Returns:
        the arithmetic mean of a and b

      • aMean

        public static double aMean(double[] doubles)
        Returns the arithmetic mean of an array of doubles.
        Parameters:
        doubles - the array of doubles, with undetermined length
        Returns:
        the arithmetic mean of all the doubles in the array

      • gMean

        public static double gMean(double a,
           double b)
        Returns the geometric mean of two doubles. The geometric mean of 'a' and 'b' is the exact square root of the product of 'a' and 'b'.
        Parameters:
        a - the first double
        b - the second double
        Returns:
        the geometric mean of a and b

      • gMean

        public static double gMean(double[] doubles)
        Returns the geometric mean of an array of doubles. Mathematical note: if any entry in the given array is equal to 0, then this method will return 0.0.
        Parameters:
        doubles - the array of doubles, with undetermined length
        Returns:
        the geometric mean of all the doubles in the array

      • log

        public static double log(double x,
         double b)
        Returns the logarithm base b of x.
        Parameters:
        x - the argument of the logarithm
        b - the base of the logarithm
        Returns:
        log_{b} (x)

      • log2

        public static double log2(double x)
        Returns the logarithm base 2 of x.
        Parameters:
        x - the argument of the logarithm
        Returns:
        log_{2} (x)

      • log10

        public static double log10(double x)
        Returns the logarithm base 10 of x.
        Parameters:
        x - the argument of the logarithm
        Returns:
        log_{10} (x)

      • ln

        public static double ln(double x)
        Returns the natural logarithm (base e) of x.
        Parameters:
        x - the argument of the logarithm
        Returns:
        ln (x)
